EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network 
at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
– Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
– Common Input Chest (Wooden Chest) at (2.5, 0.5)
– New Feeder Inserter (Feeder Inserter) at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
– Transport Belt Connection linking mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup 
at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
– Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
– Sink Chest (Wooden Chest) at (-11.5, -46.5)
– Sink Inserter (Burner Inserter) at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
– Transport Belt Connection linking the drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab 
at (5.5, 5.5) with updated Electrical Connection
Consists of:
– Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on Automation in progress)
– Electricity Network formed by Small Electric Poles (e.g. ElectricityGroup id=1281) connecting the lab to power sources

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
– Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) now showing status: NO_FUEL (fuel insertion incomplete; “out of fuel” warnings remain)
– Offshore Pump at (0.5, 30.5) (status: WORKING)
– Steam Engines:
 • Steam Engine repositioned to (19.5, 14.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings include “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”)
 • Steam Engine at (13.5, 17.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar connection warnings)
 • Steam Engine at (11.5, 20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar connection warnings)
– Note: Multiple attempts to place an additional Steam Engine adjacent to the Boiler’s steam output (candidate coordinates around (6.5, 21.5) and alternatives such as (5.5, 21.0), (5.5, 21.5), (5.5, 22.0), (6.0, 21.0)) were unsuccessful due to placement clearance and obstruction issues.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• API Parameter Accuracy:
 – When invoking pickup_entity with an Entity object as the first argument, ensure the second parameter is passed as None to avoid ValueErrors.

• Entity Placement Collision:
 – Always check that the target placement coordinates are free of existing obstructions (using can_place_entity or similar verification) before attempting to place or reposition a Steam Engine. Clear non‐critical objects cautiously, avoiding removal of essential entities (such as the Boiler).

• Reference Validation:
 – Before using relative placement functions (e.g. place_entity_next_to), confirm that the reference (local) entity is valid and not nil to prevent nil-indexing errors.

• Pipe Connection and Alignment:
 – Verify that pipe endpoints on the Boiler and Steam Engines are properly aligned and within close proximity. Adjust positions or clear blockages if pipe connection attempts fail.

• Operational Consistency:
 – Use standardized API calls and proper attribute access to ensure consistent behavior. Validate buildable areas and spacing parameters before placement to help mitigate repeated placement failures.

• Multiple Candidate Coordination:
 – In cases where manual placement attempts fail across several candidate coordinates, reassess the surrounding obstructions and consider alternative positions that do not interfere with critical structures.

• Pre-Operational Checks:
 – Prior to repositioning or placement, thoroughly verify that all environment and inventory checks have been completed to catch potential obstructions and avoid misplacement errors.
